findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: AOI - Arithmetic Operations Inconsistency
findings.description: The contract uses both SafeMath library and native arithmetic operations, which can introduce inconsistencies and undermine safety measures.

findings.title: DKO - Delete Keyword Optimization
findings.description: The contract resets variables to the default state by setting the initial values, which increases gas cost.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but the variable `numTokensSellToAddToLiquidity` can trigger a huge amount of token swaps, leading to significant price volatility due to the highly volatile token price.

findings.title: FSA - Fixed Swap Address
findings.description: The swap address is assigned once and cannot be changed, which may prevent the contract from migrating to a new liquidity pool pair or decentralized exchange.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 provide native arithmetic operations that revert to underflow and overflow.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured with user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: Using assembly can be error-prone and requires careful testing and debugging to ensure correctness.
